IAPInterface

public class IAPInterface: NSObject, UAPPProtocol

IAPInterface is the public interface for any proposition to consume InAppPurchase micro app. Its the starting intitialization point.

Since

1.0.0
  • init(dependencies:andSettings:)

    IAPInterface init method

    Since

    1.0.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    required public init(dependencies: UAPPDependencies, andSettings settings: UAPPSettings?)

    Return Value

    An instance of UAPP

  • instantiateViewController(_:withErrorHandler:)

    IAPInterface instantiateViewController will initializes the rootviewcontroller of the uApp

    Since

    1.0.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func instantiateViewController(_ launchInput: UAPPLaunchInput, withErrorHandler completionHandler: ((Error?) -> Void)? = nil) -> UIViewController?

    Return Value

    An instance of UAPP UIViewController which will be used for launching the uApp

  • fetchCompleteProductList(_:failureHandler:)

    IAPInterface fetchCompleteProductList will fetch the product ctn list

    Since

    1.0.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    open func fetchCompleteProductList(_ completion:@escaping (_ withProducts:Array<String>)->(), failureHandler: @escaping (NSError)->())

    Return Value

    The list of product CTN’s through its completion block

  • getProductCartCount(_:failureHandler:)

    IAPInterface getProductCartCount will fetch the cart count

    Since

    1.0.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    open func getProductCartCount(_ success:@escaping (Int)->(),failureHandler:@escaping (NSError)->())

    Return Value

    The cart count through its success block

  • isCartVisible(_:failureHandler:)

    IAPInterface isCartVisible method will inform the uApp for cart visibility. It’s an optional method

    Since

    3.0.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func isCartVisible(_ success:@escaping (Bool)->(), failureHandler:@escaping (NSError)->())

    Return Value

    The cart visibility as a boolean value through its success block
